points.point: We investigate the relationship between monomial ideals generated by a transformation monoid and toric ideals arrising as the kernel of a canonical ring map.
Give explicit closed-form equations for the number of generators of ideals invairant under the actions of the transformation monoid.
Describe the relationship between the ideal structure of monoidal ideals and the integer partition lattice.
Obtained nontrivial bounds for projective dimension based on the minimal number of generators of an ideal.
Made extensive use of Macaulay2's MonomialOrbits and RandomMonomialIdeals packages.
Investigated properties of linearly presented primary monomial ideals.
Obtained structure results about such ideals in low dimension and applied results to hypergraphs and socle degree.
Visualized monomials using Python and tested conjectures relating to structural properties of such ideals.
